required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cognitive Training and tDCS for Children With FASD
clinical_study.official_title: Neuromodulation Augmented Cognitive Remediation to Improve Executive Dysfunction in Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD)

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized placebo-controlled trial of cognitive training with transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) for children and adolescents (ages 10 - 16 years) with prenatal alcohol exposure (PAE).

detailed_description.textblock: Prenatal alcohol exposure (PAE) has profound detrimental effects on brain development and, as a result, has permanent consequences for cognition, learning, and behavior. Individuals with Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) commonly have a range of neurocognitive impairments that directly lead to practical problems with learning, attention, working memory, task planning/execution, and decision making, among other areas of functioning. Despite the profound public health burden posed by FASD, there have been very few treatment studies in this population. This study will examine the effects of a cognitive remediation training augmented with tDCS in children and adolescents with PAE. Functional magnetic resonance imaging will be collected to provide preliminary data of brain circuitry changes created by this intervention. The study involves a baseline visit with cognitive testing, MRI, 5 sessions of tDCS (including the baseline visit), and a 6th visit for cognitive testing and MRI. All sessions will be completed within a 28 to 56 day time window.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 1:1 randomized allocation to active tDCS or placebo (sham tDCS).
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants and families will be blinded. The principal investigator will be blinded. The research staff member coordinating the visit will be blinded. The care provider is not involved in the research and is, therefore, blinded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Learning rate will be computed over 5 sessions of tDCS spanning 28 to 56 days
primary_outcome.description: Learning rate during computerized cognitive training

secondary_outcome.time_frame: D-KEFS will be administered at baseline and at the final visit (28 to 56 days after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: D-KEFS cognitive battery measuring executive functioning skills

secondary_outcome.time_frame: D-REF will be administered at baseline and at the final visit (28 to 56 days after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Parent-report rating of executive functioning skills

secondary_outcome.time_frame: NIH Toolbox will be administered at baseline and at the final visit (28 to 56 days after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: NIH Toolbox measure of cognitive functioning

arm_group.description: 5 sessions of computerized cognitive training on tasks of attention, concentration, set-shifting, and memory - plus active tDCS (also 5 sessions).

5 sessions of computerized cognitive training on tasks of attention, concentration, set-shifting, and memory - plus sham tDCS (also 5 sessions) which consists of "placebo" stimulation with tDCS (ramp-up, but no actual stimulation).

intervention.description: Active Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) administered with a Neuroelectrics StarStim Enobio cap system (active mode)
Sham Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) administered with a Neuroelectrics StarStim Enobio cap system (sham mode)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documented heavy prenatal alcohol exposure (self-report, social service records, or adoption records) and meeting criteria for an associated FASD diagnosis (FAS, partial FAS, or ARND).
- An available parent or legal guardian capable of giving informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Substance abuse in the participant
- Neurological condition or other developmental disorder
- Serious psychiatric disorder known to affect brain functioning and cognitive performance
- Birthweight < 1500 grams
- MRI contraindication
- tDCS contraindication

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute
